intro: Strobilanthes blumei var. tomentella, commonly known as the woolly strobilanthes, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage. The plant produces striking clusters of tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink, typically blooming during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
